title: 2 Timothy Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of 2 Timothy with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 4 chapters.

questions.question: Who is the author of 2 Timothy, addressing Timothy as his dearly beloved son?
questions.explanation: Paul identifies himself as the author in 2 Timothy 1:1, calling Timothy his dearly beloved son.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 1:7, what spirit has God given us?
options: Spirit of power, love, and a sound mind
questions.correctAnswer: Spirit of power, love, and a sound mind
questions.explanation: God has not given us a spirit of fear, but of power, love, and a sound mind.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 1:5, whose faith does Paul remember in Timothy?
options: His grandmother Lois and mother Eunice
questions.correctAnswer: His grandmother Lois and mother Eunice
questions.explanation: Paul recalls the unfeigned faith that dwelt first in Timothy's grandmother Lois and his mother Eunice.

questions.question: What does Paul urge Timothy to stir up in 2 Timothy 1:6?
questions.explanation: Paul tells Timothy to stir up the gift of God which is in him by the putting on of Paul's hands.

questions.question: Who is commended for often refreshing Paul and not being ashamed of his chains according to 2 Timothy 1:16?
questions.explanation: Onesiphorus is praised for his faithful support of Paul while he was imprisoned.

questions.question: What does Paul tell Timothy to be strong in according to 2 Timothy 2:1?
options: The grace that is in Christ Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: The grace that is in Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: Paul exhorts Timothy to be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.

questions.question: To whom does Paul instruct Timothy to commit the things he has heard, as stated in 2 Timothy 2:2?
options: Faithful men who will teach others
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful men who will teach others
questions.explanation: Paul encourages Timothy to entrust the teachings to faithful men who will be able to teach others also.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 2:3, how should Timothy endure hardship?
options: As a good soldier of Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: As a good soldier of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Paul tells Timothy to endure hardness like a good soldier of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 2:15, Timothy is instructed to study to show himself what unto God?
questions.explanation: Timothy is told to study to show himself approved unto God, a workman that needs not to be ashamed.

questions.question: Who are Hymenaeus and Philetus, mentioned in 2 Timothy 2:17-18?
options: Men who have erred concerning the resurrection
questions.correctAnswer: Men who have erred concerning the resurrection
questions.explanation: They are men who have erred, teaching that the resurrection is past already and overthrowing the faith of some.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 3:1, what kind of times shall come in the last days?
questions.explanation: Paul warns that perilous times shall come in the last days.

questions.question: Which characteristic is NOT listed among the godless traits in 2 Timothy 3:2-4?
questions.explanation: The passage lists many negative traits, but not patient and kind, which are positive qualities.

questions.question: What does Paul say about those who have a form of godliness but deny its power in 2 Timothy 3:5?
questions.explanation: Paul instructs Timothy to turn away from such people.

questions.question: Who are Jannes and Jambres compared to in 2 Timothy 3:8?
questions.explanation: Jannes and Jambres resisted Moses, and similarly, some resist the truth today.

questions.question: Where did Paul suffer persecutions and afflictions as mentioned in 2 Timothy 3:11?
questions.explanation: Paul recounts his persecutions at Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 3:16, all scripture is given by what?
questions.explanation: The verse states all scripture is given by inspiration of God.

questions.question: What is the purpose of scripture according to 2 Timothy 3:16?
options: For doctrine, reproof, correction, and instruction in righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: For doctrine, reproof, correction, and instruction in righteousness
questions.explanation: Scripture is profitable for teaching and guiding believers.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 4:2, Paul charges Timothy to preach the word with what qualities?
questions.explanation: Paul instructs Timothy to preach the word, reprove, rebuke, and exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine.

questions.question: What will people do in the latter times concerning sound doctrine, according to 2 Timothy 4:3?
options: Reject sound doctrine and heap to themselves teachers after their own lusts
questions.correctAnswer: Reject sound doctrine and heap to themselves teachers after their own lusts
questions.explanation: Paul warns that people will not endure sound doctrine but will follow their own desires.

questions.question: At the end of his life, Paul says in 2 Timothy 4:7 that he has done what?
options: Fought a good fight, finished his course, kept the faith
questions.correctAnswer: Fought a good fight, finished his course, kept the faith
questions.explanation: Paul summarizes his faithful service and perseverance.

questions.question: Who is said to have forsaken Paul, loving this present world, according to 2 Timothy 4:10?
questions.explanation: Demas is mentioned as having forsaken Paul because he loved the present world.

questions.question: Who is the only companion with Paul at the time of writing 2 Timothy, as stated in 2 Timothy 4:11?
questions.explanation: Paul states that only Luke is with him.

questions.question: What item did Paul leave at Troas with Carpus, which he asks Timothy to bring, according to 2 Timothy 4:13?
questions.explanation: Paul requests Timothy to bring the cloke he left at Troas with Carpus.

questions.question: Who is described as a coppersmith who did Paul much evil in 2 Timothy 4:14?
questions.explanation: Alexander the coppersmith is noted for opposing Paul's words.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 4:18, Paul expresses confidence that the Lord will do what for him?
options: Deliver him from every evil work and preserve him unto His heavenly kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: Deliver him from every evil work and preserve him unto His heavenly kingdom
questions.explanation: Paul trusts God to rescue him and keep him safe until the kingdom.

questions.question: What does Paul urge Timothy to do before winter, as stated in 2 Timothy 4:21?
questions.explanation: Paul wants Timothy to come to him before winter.

questions.question: Who are greeted along with Prisca, Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus in 2 Timothy 4:19?
questions.explanation: Paul sends greetings to these individuals and all the brethren.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 2:22, what does Paul encourage Timothy to flee?
questions.explanation: Paul tells Timothy to flee youthful lusts and follow righteousness, faith, charity, and peace.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 1:9, how has God called us?
options: With an holy calling, not according to our works, but according to His own purpose and grace
questions.correctAnswer: With an holy calling, not according to our works, but according to His own purpose and grace
questions.explanation: God's calling is based on His own purpose and grace, not our works.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a characteristic of people in the last days in 2 Timothy 3:2-4?
questions.explanation: The passage describes people as lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God.

questions.question: What is the foundation of God described as in 2 Timothy 2:19?
options: Sure, having this seal: The Lord knoweth them that are his
questions.correctAnswer: Sure, having this seal: The Lord knoweth them that are his
questions.explanation: The foundation of God stands sure and is marked by the Lord's knowledge of His own.

questions.question: What analogy does Paul use in 2 Timothy 2:3-4 to describe Christian endurance?
options: A soldier not entangled in worldly affairs
questions.correctAnswer: A soldier not entangled in worldly affairs
questions.explanation: Paul likens enduring hardship to a soldier who does not entangle himself with the affairs of life.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Timothy 3:16, scripture is profitable for doctrine, reproof, correction, and instruction in righteousness.
questions.explanation: This verse states clearly the purpose of scripture for teaching and correction.

questions.question: True or False: In 2 Timothy 4:6, Paul says he is not yet ready to be offered and that his departure is far off.
questions.explanation: Paul says he is now ready to be offered and the time of his departure is at hand.

questions.question: True or False: In 2 Timothy 1:7, God has given us the spirit of fear to keep us cautious.
questions.explanation: God has not given us a spirit of fear, but of power, love, and a sound mind.

questions.question: True or False: Paul instructs Timothy to avoid foolish and unlearned questions because they gender strifes, according to 2 Timothy 2:23.
questions.explanation: Paul advises Timothy to avoid such questions to prevent disputes.

questions.question: True or False: In 2 Timothy 4:4, Paul says people will turn their ears to the truth and reject fables.
questions.explanation: Paul warns they will turn away from the truth and be turned unto fables.

questions.question: True or False: Paul calls Timothy his dearly beloved son in the faith in 2 Timothy 1:2.
questions.explanation: Paul addresses Timothy as his dearly beloved son and sends grace, mercy, and peace.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Timothy 2:21, if a man purges himself, he will be a vessel unto dishonor.
questions.explanation: Purging oneself leads to being a vessel unto honor, sanctified and meet for good works.

questions.question: True or False: In 2 Timothy 3:13, evil men and seducers shall wax worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived.
questions.explanation: Paul describes the increasing wickedness of evil men and seducers.

questions.question: True or False: Paul instructs Timothy to rebuke only gently and never to be patient, as per 2 Timothy 2:24.
questions.explanation: Paul says the servant of the Lord must be gentle to all men, apt to teach, and patient.

questions.question: True or False: Paul expresses confidence that the Lord strengthened him and delivered him from the mouth of the lion in 2 Timothy 4:17.
questions.explanation: Paul acknowledges the Lord's help in his ministry and deliverance.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for ______, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:'
questions.explanation: The verse teaches that scripture is profitable for doctrine, among other things.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a ______ mind.'
questions.explanation: God gives a spirit of power, love, and a sound mind, not fear.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Preach the word; be instant in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all longsuffering and ______.'
questions.explanation: Timothy is charged to preach with longsuffering and doctrine.
